summary: Email from attorney Jeanne M. Christensen to an unspecified recipient, attaching documents related to financial transactions from Leon Black and associated entities to a female recipient. The attachments include bank statements, texts/emails, and references to an NDA, suggesting a legal dispute or investigation involving financial support and confidentiality agreements.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Partner at Wigdor LLP who is sending documents including bank statements, texts, and emails related to financial transfers from Leon Black and associated entities to a female recipient.

persons.name: Leon J. Black
persons.context: Individual whose accounts ("Leon J. Black", "J. Black Trust", "E Trust") are shown to have made wire payments ranging from $15K to $167K to a female recipient from November 2015 until 2021.

persons.name: Melanie Spinella
persons.context: Described as Leon Black's longtime trusted admin assistant; sample texts and emails involving her are included in the attachments.

connections.description: Bank statements show wire payments from Black's accounts to the recipient from 2015 to 2021.
Spinella is described as Black's longtime trusted administrative assistant.
Christensen is providing legal representation, gathering and sending documents on behalf of the recipient.

events.title: Start of financial transfers
events.description: Beginning of wire payments from Leon Black's associated accounts to a female recipient.

events.title: Cessation of payments
events.description: Wire payments from Black's accounts to the recipient ceased after 2021.

events.title: Request for NDA copy
events.description: The recipient asked Leon Black for a copy of a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA).

locations: 85 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY 10003 (Wigdor LLP office)
keyFacts: Bank statements show wire payments from accounts associated with Leon J. Black ("Leon J. Black", "J. Black Trust", "E Trust") to a female recipient, ranging from $15,000 to $167,000.
Payments occurred from November 2015 until 2021, when they ceased.
The correspondence includes references to an NDA (Non-Disclosure Agreement) and a request from the recipient for a copy of it in October 2019.
Attorney Jeanne M. Christensen is representing the recipient and providing documents including texts/emails with Leon Black's assistant Melanie Spinella and contacts at Goldman Sachs.
